entries.title: Technical Consultant
points: Provided web development, advanced networking design, and assorted technical services

entries.title: Phisherman
points: Developed a novel image-recognition-based anti-phishing solution
Detected 74% of zero-day phishing sites in a simulated test

entries.title: Cyber Security Intern
points: Designed and partially implemented a real-time vulnerability monitoring application
Collaborated in the configuration of multiple virtualized environments

entries.title: Google Games NYC
points: 1st place, against other top college teams from the NYC metro area
Solved programming/algorithms challenges in a small time under high pressure

entries.title: Northeast Collegiate Cyber Defense Competition
points: Placed 5th out of 8 teams that qualified for regionals
Worked with a team to secured & protect diverse physical and cloud infrastructure on multiple platforms in a high-pressure, fast-paced environment

entries.title: Penn State Cybersecurity Competition
points: Identified and described vulnerabilities in binaries using core dumps and instruction traces
Placed 1st out of 6 teams

entries.title: CSAW Capture-the-Flag
points: Competed in a global virtual competition by solving reverse-engineering, exploitation, and other security challenges within a team
Placed 151st out of 1444 teams worldwide

entries.title: Tutor
points: Tutored students in Discrete Math for Cryptography, a challenging 500-level cybersecurity course
Prepared students for exams and assisted with homework

entries.title: Mid-Atlantic Collegiate Cyber Defense Competition
points: Secured & hardened Linux, Windows, and IoT devices in a mock production environment

entries.title: Lifeguard
points: Certified Red Cross lifeguard - 2014-2016
Ensured the safety of swimmers and patrons

entries.title: Hello-Metal
points: Built a small "hello world"-style kernel for the x86 platform
Wrote a memory manager, long mode support, and various hardware drivers

entries.title: Cliq
points: Built an interactive, real-time forum as a social platform
Developed in Common Lisp for extensibility
Written from scratch on a custom web framework

entries.title: Microblog
points: Created a lightweight, easy-to-deploy microblogging platform
Built for security using Python, Flask, and Postgres

entries.title: Embedded-Python
points: Developed a library to integrate Python and Common Lisp, promoting inter-language library reuse and rapid prototyping

entries.title: CLTM
entries.subtitle: Common Lisp Transactional Memory
points: Built a Software Transactional Memory library to eliminate data races without requiring a code rewrite
